Comments_List: I developed many key research skills such as data entry.
Did a lot of directed reading for my senior thesis topic. Was nice to get credit for it.

I gained insight into the administrative functioning of a lab setting and the importance of community outreach to a lab's functioning when the lab's studies require participants outside the typical age boundaries of students. I was able to hone my persuasive writing skills in writing requests for collaboration and my organizational skills when coordinating recruitment teams of research assistants.
Conducting research with canine subjects, dealing with guardians, coding behaviors.
The design, production, execution, analysis, and writing of original research.
Allows students to find a lab their are interested in and to develop a passion for research.
I would recommend this course. It is not a crazy time commitment and if you find a lab you are very interested in, it does not seem like work.
Yes, if you want to get some credit for doing some light research, or writing a lit review for your senior project or some other capstone.
Join dog lab! Best decision at Yale! You'll learn so so much and it gives unique opportunities for undergrads to pursue projects and learn from fantastic grad students.
